definition: lit. when the seas run dry and the stones go soft (idiom)/fig. forever/until the end of time
ocean/sea/CL:個|个[ge4],片[pian4]/great number of people or things/(dialect) numerous
surname Hai
dried up
dry measure for grain equal to ten dou 斗/ten pecks/one hundred liters
rock/stone/stone inscription/one of the eight categories of ancient musical instruments 八音[ba1 yin1]
surname Shi
soft/mushy/well-cooked and soft/to rot/to decompose/rotten/worn out/chaotic/messy/utterly/thoroughly/crappy/bad

sentences.english: Friendship does not last forever, and no highest power of love.
sentences.chinese: 沒有天長地久的友情，更沒有海枯石爛的愛情。

sentences.english: No one wants to wait for you, do not say wait until forever in the sea.
sentences.chinese: 沒有人願意等你，也不必說等到天荒地老，海枯石爛。

sentences.english: Nor in ocean wilt thou find.
sentences.chinese: 海枯石爛汝也難以找到。
愛情真的是海枯石爛的嗎？

sentences.english: I am not greed but I envy.
sentences.chinese: 我沒有貪婪鳦我羨慕海枯石爛。

sentences.english: You make me the happiest man in the world.
sentences.chinese: 妳可以信賴我直到海枯石爛。

sentences.english: I can pull your hand, accompanied you to arrive in ancient times, dry seas and crumbling rocks.
sentences.chinese: 我會牽着你的手，陪你到天荒地老，海枯石爛。

sentences.english: Darling, you can count on me till the sun dries up the sea.
sentences.chinese: 親愛的，你可以依靠着我直到海枯石爛。

sentences.english: Even if the seas go dry and rocks crumble, my will will remain firm.
sentences.chinese: 縱然海枯石爛，意志永不動搖。

sentences.english: Once the lasting, is worth but you last sentence good gather good spread.
sentences.chinese: 曾經的海枯石爛，抵不過你最後一句好聚好散。

sentences.english: Don't believe lasting pledge, because you can't wait that day.
sentences.chinese: 不要相信海枯石爛的誓言，因爲你等不到那一天。

definition: lit. a dream of Nanke/fig. dreams of grandeur
erosion/abrasion
to obstinately persist in going about things the wrong way (idiom)
to view death as a return home/to not be afraid of dying/to face death with equanimity (idiom)
the moth flies into the flame/fatal attraction
virtue has its rewards (idiom); one good turn deserves another
for ever and ever
to write off at one stroke
to go through water and tread on fire (idiom); not afraid of any difficulty
reluctant to part
affectionate/an affectionate person
to keep silent
to have no cares/to be carefree
to amuse oneself/to play with/to tease
mountain and river exhausted (idiom); at the end of the line/nowhere to go
to regard the four corners of the world all as home (idiom)/to feel at home anywhere/to roam about unconstrained/to consider the entire country, or world, to be one's own
